title: Lazard's Blake Runs a Small Portfolio With Big Diversification
text:
Lazard’s Blake Runs a Small Portfolio With Big Diversification Highly concentrated funds are often more volatile. This fund isn’t. By Lawrence C. Strauss August 15, 2015 
For many money managers, a 20-stock portfolio poses too much risk. Pick a bad stock or two, and it can take years to recover. Chris Blake, who runs the Lazard US Equity Concentrated Portfolio (ticker: LEVOX), doesn’t buy that. The more concentrated, the better. Twenty stocks with different business models provide sufficient diversification, he says. He may be on to something: In the three-plus years since Blake began managing the $628 million, 10-year-old fund, its annual return of 19.4% bested 95% of its peers in Morningstar’s large-cap blend category.
